body_html: Yes, this could make sense as a transformation called tf.contrib.data.assert_element_shape(). The internal _RestructuredDataset class could be useful when implementing it. (It's currently used in tf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder() to achieve a similar effect.)
body_text: Yes, this could make sense as a transformation called tf.contrib.data.assert_element_shape(). The internal _RestructuredDataset class could be useful when implementing it. (It's currently used in tf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder() to achieve a similar effect.)
body: Yes, this could make sense as a transformation called `tf.contrib.data.assert_element_shape()`. The [internal `_RestructuredDataset` class](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/07e497b0ad3f0e102e167a50de2b543a4a238fde/tensorflow/contrib/data/python/ops/batching.py#L260) could be useful when implementing it. (It's currently used in `tf.contrib.data.batch_and_drop_remainder()` to achieve a similar effect.)
